topics.body:
"@Ore-O":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53caa0d9636872542e2c0300#post_53caa0d9636872542e2c0300
The immediate reason why is that the operations will switch from anti-insurgency operations to anti-terrorism operations.  The separatists will be labeled as international terrorists and the war on terrorism will have a new front.  If Russia continues to support the separatists military wise they'll face severe sanctions and Russia's economy relies on international trade; if they were to get sanctioned their entire country would tank economically.

Once clear evidence that the rebels shot it down pops up Russia will have no choice but to pull support for them.  Without Russia's support the rebels will fall apart extremely quickly.  To continue to support the rebels at this point would be outright suicidal of Russia.

Their only option at this point is to destroy any and all evidence or they're going to get metaphorically ass raped hard.

If I was one of the rebels right about now is the point at which I would desert.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
It's my first time wearing a bathing suit this season. It's a little scary.

I look a lot better from last year, having lost 15 pounds and all, but I still have my trademark baby-birthing hips. Don't get me wrong, I'm not fat or anything, but my hips have always been the hugest part of my body. Hope it doesn't attract too much attention.

This one time when one of them wouldn't stop asking me for my phone number, I gave him my grandfather's. The oldtimer later told me that was a fun conversation.
